articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Bolivian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Bolivian President
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a congratulatory message to Evo Morales Aima, president of Bolivia, on Tuesday as regards the World Conference of Peoples to be held in Bolivia at his positive proposal.
					 Expressing conviction that this historic conference to be opened amid great expectation and interest of the world people would result in good fruition, Kim in the message wished the president bigger successes in his work.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Mongolian FM
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Mongolian FM
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met had a talk with Gombojab Zandanshatar, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Mongolia, and his party who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
					 He also met and had a talk with Edward Pietrzyk, new Polish ambassador to the DPRK, at the hall on the same day when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Mongolian FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Mongolian FM
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Talks between Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, and Gombojab Zandanshatar, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Mongolia, took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Ri Sok Chol, vice-minister of Agriculture, Kim Kyu Rak, vice-minister of Fisheries, and other officials concerned and from the Mongolian side the party of the minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade and Sodovjamts Khurelbaatar, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 At the talks the two sides informed each other of the situations in their countries and exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly relations between the two countries and matters of mutual concern.

articles.title: DPRK Govt Gives Banquet for Mongolian FM
articles.content:
DPRK Govt Gives Banquet for Mongolian FM
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- A banquet was given by the DPRK government in honor of Gombojab Zandanshatar, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Mongolia, on a visit to the DPRK at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
					 Present there on invitation were Gombojab Zandanshatar and his party and Sodovjamts Khurelbaatar, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 Pak Ui Chun said in his speech at the banquet that the relations between the two countries have a long history of more than 60 years as its roots were provided by President Kim Il Sung and leaders of Mongolia.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the DPRK government to steadily boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, he said, expressing belief that the visit of the minister would contribute to boosting the bilateral relations.
					
					 Gombojab Zandanshatar said in his speech that the friendly relations between the two countries provided by leaders of Mongolia and President Kim Il Sung have further developed.
					
					 He expressed wholehearted thanks to Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, for having paid deep attention to the development of the traditional friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Mongolian FM Here
articles.content:
Mongolian FM Here
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Gombojab Zandanshatar, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Mongolia, and his party arrived here on Tuesday.
					 They were greeted at the airport by Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, and Sodovjamts Khurelbaatar, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Yong Ho Meets Cuban Military Delegation
articles.content:
Yong Ho Meets Cuban Military Delegation
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Ho, chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, Tuesday met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the Cuban Revolutionary Armed Forces headed by Alvaro Lopez Miera, vice-minister of Revolutionary Armed Forces and chief of the General Staff.
					 Present on the occasion were Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, general officers and other officers of the KPA and Ambassador Jose Manuel Galego Montano and Military Attache Leonardo Perez Mesa of the Cuban embassy here.

articles.title: Gift from CGS of Cuban Revolutionary Armed Forces
articles.content:
Gift from CGS of Cuban Revolutionary Armed Forces
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Alvaro Lopez Miera, vice-minister and chief of the General Staff of the Cuban Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba, on a visit to the DPRK.
					 It was handed to Ri Yong Ho, chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, by Alvaro Lopez Miera on Tuesday.

articles.title: KPA Hosts Reception for Cuban Military Delegation
articles.content:
KPA Hosts Reception for Cuban Military Delegation
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The General Staff of the Korean People's Army hosted a reception in honor of the visiting delegation of the Cuban Revolutionary Armed Forces on Tuesday.
					 Present there on invitation were members of the delegation led by Alvaro Lopez Miera, vice-minister and chief of the General Staff of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba, and Ambassador Jose Manuel Galego Montano and Military Attache Leonardo Perez Mesa of the Cuban embassy here.
					
					 Ri Yong Ho, chief of the KPA General Staff, Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, general officers and other officers of the KPA were on hand.
					
					 Ri Yong Ho said at the reception that the delegation's visit to the DPRK marks an important occasion in developing the friendly and cooperative ties between the armies of the two countries and the overall bilateral relations on a higher stage.
					
					 Noting that under the leadership of respected Fidel Castro Ruz and Raul Castro Ruz the Cuban army and people have reliably defended the gains of the revolution, he expressed full support and solidarity with the Cuban people in their struggle to uphold independence against imperialism and the principle of socialism, bolster up the national defence capability and raise the country's international prestige.
					
					 The army and the people of the DPRK will as ever strive to boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the Cuban army and people, he declared.
					
					Alvaro Lopez Miera said in his speech that this year marks the significant 50th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic ties between Cuba and the DPRK, adding that the friendly bonds between the two countries have grown deep.
					
					He stressed that the fraternal and comradely friendly relations between the two countries which were provided by Fidel Castro Ruz and President Kim Il Sung have grown stronger thanks to Raul Castro Ruz and Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Noting that Cuba and the DPRK have the same ideal, he stressed the need to boost the traditional relations between the armies of the two countries.
					
					The two armies and peoples will pool their efforts and consolidate their militant fraternity as they have the common goal, he stressed.

articles.title: Cuban Military Delegation Herea
articles.content:
Cuban Military Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Cuban Revolutionary Armed Forces led by Alvaro Lopez Miera, vice-minister of Revolutionary Armed Forces and chief of the General Staff, arrived here on Tuesday.
					 A ceremony for welcoming the delegation took place before the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower.
					
					 Present there were Alvaro Lopez Miera, members of the delegation, the Cuban ambassador to the DPRK and the military attache of the Cuban embassy here.
					
					 Ri Yong Ho, chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, general officers and other officers of the KPA were on hand.
					
					 Alvaro Lopez Miera together with Ri Yong Ho reviewed the KPA guards of honor.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to China Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to China Appointed
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Choe Pyong Gwan was appointed as DPRK ambassador to China, according to a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Credentials of Moroccan Ambassador Accepted
articles.content:
Credentials of Moroccan Ambassador Accepted
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Jaafar Alj Hakim, Moroccan ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
					 After receiving the credentials, he had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Indonesia Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Indonesia Marked
Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- A film show and a friendly meeting were held at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Tuesday 45 years after General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited Indonesia in company with President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present there on invitation were Charge d'Affaires ad Interim Fitri Riyanti and staff members of the Indonesian embassy here.
					
					 Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairman of the DPRK-Indonesia Friendship Association, and officials concerned were on hand.
					
					 The participants watched the Korean documentary film "President Kim Il Sung Meets Foreign Heads of State and Prominent Figures" (Part 1).
					
					 Then followed a friendly meeting at which speeches were made. Speakers described Kim Jong Il's Indonesia visit in company with Kim Il Sung as a historic event that opened a new chapter of the DPRK-Indonesia friendship.
					
					 They expressed belief that the long-standing relations of friendship between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, too.
					
					 The participants enjoyed an art performance of schoolchildren and talked to each other about the matter of further developing the bilateral relationship.

articles.title: New Documentary Film Produced
articles.content:
New Documentary Film Produced
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The Korean Documentary and Science Film Studio recently produced documentary film "150-day and 100-day Campaigns that Made a Breakthrough towards Building an Economic Power." 
					The film deals with historic facts about the shining successes made by the Korean people in the efforts to build a thriving nation under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il who personally initiated the 150-day and 100-day campaigns and led them.
					
					 It tells stories that Kim Jong Il laid an eternal foundation for building a rich and powerful nation through the successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong-2 and another successful nuclear test and made endless journeys of forced march of high intensity for providing field guidance to various sectors of the national economy, the trips characterized by his indefatigable efforts and patriotic devotion.
					
					 It deals with the successes made by the workers of the Songjin Steel Complex in rounding off the Juche iron production system of Korean style, those achieved by the workers in the field of the machine- building industry in putting production processes on a CNC basis and the labor achievements made by the workers of the February 8 Vinalon Complex, the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex and the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex.
					
					 It also recounts stories that "Huichon speed", a new Chollima speed, was created in the major construction sites and there sprang up Mansudae Street, the Taedonggang Tile Factory, Majon Hotel and other monumental edifices in the era of Songun.

articles.title: High-speed Charger Developed
articles.content:
High-speed Charger Developed
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- A new model of high-speed charger has been developed by the Mathematics Research Institute of the State Academy of Sciences of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The charger fully electrifies a battery in one or two hours and prolongs the battery's serviceable life 1.2 times.
					
					 It is capable of removing sulphate from sulphatized battery.
					
					 It, also called "CNC charger", consists of voltage stabilizer for rectified charging, a charging control program, etc. 
					
					 It automatically works according to preset size of battery and mode and time of charging.
					
					 It can charge batteries of different sizes simultaneously.
					
					 It, small in size, low in cost of production and convenient for use, has already begun to be used in many units.

articles.title: Mt. Jongbang
articles.content:
Mt. Jongbang
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Mt. Jongbang, one of the beauty spots in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, is standing in the northern suburbs of Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province.
					 Many years ago, President Kim Il Sung climbed the mountain with various species of flowers and trees growing thickly and many kinds of birds and animals dwelling. In the mountain he found magnolia and suggested that it be the national flower of the DPRK.  
					
					 Mt. Jongbang, 481 meters in height, is surrounded by lower mountains and Pongsannamuri, Hwangjugindung, Jaeryong and other plains.
					
					 It, with wonderful peaks, over-100-meter-high mysterious cliffs, falls, legend-rich mineral springs and the like, presents a picturesque landscape.
					
					 There is a 12-kilometer-long fort in the mountain. It, erected in the period of Koryo (918-1392), has been known as the strongest one in the area of Hwanghae Province.
					
					 Among the historic relics of the mountain are the fort's Nam Gate with a one-storied large tower, Songbul Temple built in 898 and five-storied quadrangular stone pagoda.
					
					 There is also a scorpion habitat registered as a natural monument in the mountain.
					
					  The mountain attracts many people, including overseas Koreans and foreigners.

articles.title: Japan's Moves to Emerge Military Giant under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Moves to Emerge Military Giant under Fire
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The minister of Defence of Japan was recently reported to have cried out for reexamining the application of the "three principles of arms export" while its minister of Foreign Affairs blustered Japan should not rule out the shipment of nukes by the U.S. forces.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 Such venomous militarist remarks openly made by the Japanese ruling quarters are nothing but a revelation of the reckless moves stepped up by those with daggers hidden in their belts to turn Japan into a military giant and launch reinvasion.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' call for reexamining the above-said principles is aimed at clearing the hurdles lying in the way of converting Japan into a military power for overseas aggression.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are now so emboldened as to discard the "three principles of arms export" which they have advocated for form's sake and rush headlong into the moves to turn Japan into a military giant.
					
					 Their ulterior intention is to have the cumbersome principles scrapped.
					
					 The outbursts let loose by a high-ranking politician of Japan underscoring the necessity of the shipment of U.S. nukes under the pretext of "contingency" are nothing but a dangerous signal to rush headlong into nuclear weaponization in blatant breach of the above-said principles.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries, who persist in their moves to let their country go nuclear, seek to legalize the shipment of U.S. nukes and make it an established fact under the pretext of "contingency" in a bid to completely eliminate the "three non-nuclear principles" which exist in name only.
					
					 Japan's moves to turn itself into a military power and go nuclear are obviously linked with its scenario to stage a comeback to Korea.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries will be made to suffer a horrible disaster if they keep going reckless, seized with the wild militarist ambition quite contrary to the trend of the times.

articles.title: Minju Joson Calls for Eliminating Product of Cold War
articles.content:
Minju Joson Calls for Eliminating Product of Cold War
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the Western European Union issued a statement and declared the union dissolved.
					 This has brought to an end the existence of the union, a product of the Cold War era that has lasted for several decades.
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard: This indicates that it has become the desire common to humankind and the trend of the times to eliminate the product of the Cold War era and achieve peace and stability worldwide.
					
					 But the state of ceasefire, a product of the Cold War era, still persists on the Korean Peninsula, gravely threatening regional peace and stability, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. has kicked up a noisy racket to provoke a new war to seize the DPRK by force of arms.
					
					 Once a war breaks out on the Korean Peninsula, it may quickly escalate into a worldwide thermonuclear war.
					
					 To defuse tension and ensure peace on the peninsula is, therefore, not a simple regional matter but a very important and responsible task to save Asia and the rest of the world from the disaster of a nuclear war.
					
					 The replacement of the armistice agreement by a peace treaty would help defuse the military confrontation on the peninsula and automatically settle the issue of building confidence between the DPRK and the U.S. and, furthermore, create a peaceful environment in the Asia-Pacific. 
					
					 Whether a war is averted and peace ensured on the peninsula or not entirely depends on the U.S. attitude.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to face up to the trend of the times toward reconciliation, cooperation and peace, put an end to the state of ceasefire, a product of the Cold War era, and immediately respond to the proposal for concluding a peace treaty.

articles.title: People Called upon to Become Genuine Patriots
articles.content:
People Called upon to Become Genuine Patriots
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday editorially calls upon all the people of the DPRK to perform shining heroic exploits in the on-going general offensive for winning a victory in the drive for building a great prosperous and powerful nation in response to the call of the Workers' Party of Korea and thus strikingly demonstrate the honor of being genuine patriots always remembered by the party and the country like the heroes and heroines in the period of the great Chollima surge.
					  It goes on:
					
					 The above-said heroes and heroines displayed inexhaustible mental power in the difficult post-war period of rehabilitation and construction, thus building a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defense, on this land. The shining example set by them taught the people how they should struggle to become patriots to be remembered by the party and the country.
					
					 The on-going grandiose struggle for the victory in the drive for building a thriving nation has produced a large number of ardent patriots in the Songun era like those heroes and heroines emerged in the period of the great Chollima surge, it notes, adding that it is great pride of the DPRK to see the ranks of such genuine patriots and heroes expand day by day.
					
					The Chollima spirit instilled by President Kim Il Sung into the people helped produce a large number of well-known and unsung patriots and heroes in the 1950s and the revolutionary soldier spirit taught by General Secretary Kim Jong Il to the people at present serves as a weapon for performing miracles and exploits in the on-going struggle for winning a victory in the drive for a great revolutionary surge, notes the editorial.
					
					 All the people should perform exploits, racing against the time, like the creators of the Huichon speed, a new Chollima speed, by making the waves of the drive for a great surge sweep the whole country with the soldier spirit, mettle and stamina and thus fully demonstrate the revolutionary mettle of the Korean people struggling, guided by aphorism that the word "impossible" is not to be found in the Korean vocabulary, it says.

articles.title: Development of Mass Culture and Arts Called for
articles.content:
Development of Mass Culture and Arts Called for
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Mass culture and arts serve as an effective weapon for giving play to the mental power of the masses.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a signed article.
					
					 Popular performing activities have displayed great vitality in the whole course of the Korean revolution and construction, it notes, and goes on:
					
					 The elder generation of the Korean revolution created and disseminated the revolutionary hymn "Star of Korea," making songs praising the leader resound forth everywhere and encouraging all the people in their courageous struggle for the liberation of the country full of faith and optimism. In the days of the war frontline concerts were given on each height to make enemy troops shiver.
					
					 In the post-war period the Korean people could bring about a great Chollima surge, smashing passivism and conservatism and all the servicepersons and people could victoriously conclude the "Arduous March," the forced march. This was possible entirely thanks to the Workers' Party of Korea that made sure that dynamic revolutionary and mass performing activities were conducted to help the party members and other working people live and struggle with confidence in victory and optimism about future.
					
					 Mass cultural and art activities serve as effective means for arousing the masses and making the whole country seethe with revolutionary enthusiasm and optimism and an engine for getting the whole society pervaded with revolutionary enthusiasm and militant stamina.
					
					 Dynamic mass performing activities instill redoubled strength and courage into the people and make them feel the worth of working hard. It was against this backdrop that the Kanggye spirit was created and torches were lit at the Songjin Steel Complex and the Ranam Coal Mining Machine Complex to make the waves of a high-pitched drive for effecting new innovations and performing miracles sweep the whole country.
					
					 When all fields and units conduct brisk mass cultural and art activities as required by the era of a great surge, the ideological and moral power of the masses will be given full play and revolutionary spirit run high throughout the country, concludes the article.

articles.title: Struggle for Reunification Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle for Reunification Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations of different strata in south Korea held a meeting in Seoul on April 16 on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the April 19 Popular Uprising.
					 The participants in the meeting declared that the present regime represents the remnant forces of Yusin dictatorship and a dictatorial regime which grabbed power through a "May 16 military coup" after bringing the success of the April 19 uprising to naught. 
					
					 Since the emergence of the present regime achievements made by people from all walks of life in the struggle for democracy at the cost of blood have been totally denied, the people's living has been further deteriorated and the inter-Korean relations have been brought back to those of confrontation in the past, they deplored.
					
					 Noting that the prevailing situation bears a close resemblance to the situation on the eve of the April 19 uprising, they called upon all the people to turn out in the struggle to achieve democratic rights and realize independent reunification by carrying forward the spirit displayed by the participants in the uprising half a century ago.
					
					 They reiterated their will to make every effort to bring earlier a new era of independent reunification on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Suppress Labor Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Suppress Labor Flayed
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a press conference in Seoul on April 15 denouncing the puppet authorities for their moves to suppress the labor movement.
					 The speakers at the press conference accused the authorities of intensifying the suppression of the Teachers' Union after labeling its movement for issuing a declaration on the situation as "political activities" and branding the Government Employees' Union as an "illegal organization".
					
					 The authorities' ceaseless suppression is aimed at liquidating the leading organizations under the confederation in a bid to stamp out the labor movement, they held.
					
					 A press release read out at the press conference declared that the organization would respond to dialogue with dialogue and react to the suppression with struggle.
					
					 The "government" and the management side will face an all-out struggle of the workers including a general strike unless they respond to dialogue till April 25, it warned.

articles.title: Day of Sun Commemorated
articles.content:
Day of Sun Commemorated
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Political parties, government ministries, organizations and institutions and personages of different countries and the "International Kim Il Sung Foundation" sent floral baskets to the DPRK missions between April 10 and 15 to commemorate the Day of the Sun.
					 Among them were the Commission for External Affairs of the C.C., the Communist Party, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development, the Ministry of Industry and Commerce, the Journalists Association, the Ho Chi Minh Museum, the Department of International Cooperation of the Ministry of Public Security and the Diplomatic Corps Service Department of Vietnam, the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Association, the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Kindergarten and the Viettel Group of Vietnam, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia, Indonesian companies including the Rabitra Bahtera Pratama Co., the Badja Machine Co., and the P.T. Dwi Mitra Perkasa Co., the Foreign Relations Committee of the Consultative Council of Egypt, the Emperor Group and the Golden Trip Travel Service Ltd. in Hong Kong of China and other companies.
					
					 There were also the minister of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba, the deputy general secretary of the Baath Arab Socialist Party, vice presidents, the deputy regional secretary of the Baath Arab Socialist Party and the director of the Organizational Department and the director of the Security Department of the Party Regional Leadership, the minister of Defence, the chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces, the chairman of the Trade Unions Federation and the chairman of the General Union of Peasants of Syria, the chairwoman of the Central Directive Council of the Democratic Party of Struggle, the speaker of the People's Consultative Assembly, the minister of State for Cooperatives and Small-Medium Enterprises and the chief of the Police Command of Indonesia, the general secretary of the Party for Unity and Progress of Guinea, the vice-chairman of the National Democratic Party of Egypt, the secretary general of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association, the president of t
					
					 he "C.I.S. Estero" Group of Italy and the chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru.

articles.title: Eq. Guinea Figure Issues Statemen
articles.content:
Eq. Guinea Figure Issues Statement
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Lucas Nguema Esono, general secretary of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea, issued a statement on April 12 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 He in the statement said: On the occasion of the 98th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the prominent leader of the Korean people, we recall with deep emotion the immortal exploits he performed in the course of founding and leading the DPRK and the facts that he extended mental and material support to the African countries and peoples, the Equatorial Guinean government and people in particular, in the efforts for independence, sovereignty and social wellbeing.
					
					 He hoped that the friendly relations between his party and the Workers' Party of Korea based on the common interests would continue to develop on good terms in the future, too.

articles.title: DPRK's April Holidays Observed
articles.content:
DPRK's April Holidays Observed
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held in UK, Guinea and Nigeria between April 7 and 9 to commemorate the Day of the Sun and the 17th anniversary of General Secretary
					 Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain noted that he had the high honor to be granted an audience with President Kim Il Sung when visiting the DPRK, which offered him an occasion to keenly feel the greatness of the President revered by the whole world. The President was the great leader of the people without parallel in human history, he said.
					
					 He said with high appreciation that Kim Jong Il who is successfully carrying forward the President's revolutionary idea and exploits, has performed immortal feats for the human cause of independence by wisely leading the Korean people in the cause of building a thriving nation.
					
					 The chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said at the seminar on Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might" that the work serves as guidelines of struggle for not only the Korean people but also the progressive mankind advocating independence of each country and nation.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar held in UK.
					
					 Meanwhile, remembrance meetings took place in Thailand, the Czech Republic and Mexico on April 9 and 10 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- One day in June Juche 35 (1946) a Pyongyang-based newspaper carried a news item about poor living conditions of the south Korean workers.
					 Anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk, after reading the newspaper early in the morning, gave it to an official to read the news item.
					
					 Listening to his impressions of the story, she told him that it made her worried about the poor conditions of the south Korean workers and that though Korea had been liberated from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule, the southern half of the country had still remained in a miserable situation caused by the U.S. military presence. She also said the anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters had shed their blood for the liberation of the whole country, but those in a half of the country were still leading a wretched life.
					
					 She then said that the U.S. imperialist aggression forces should be withdrawn from south Korea as quickly as possible so that the south Korean people could also enjoy benefits of democratic policies, adding that great efforts should be exerted to this end.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador marroqui
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador marroqui
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ATCC) -- Jaafar Alj Hakim presento el dia 20 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, las cartas credenciales que le acreditan como embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario del Reino de Marruecos en Corea.
					Tras recibirlas, Kim Yong Nam departio con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun departe con su homologo mongol
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun departe con su homologo mongol
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 20 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las conversaciones entre el canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun y el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y Comercio de Mongolia Gombojab Zandanshatar.
					En la ocasion participaron por la parte coreana el viceministro de Agricultura Ri Sok Chol, el viceministro de Industria Pesquera Kim Kyu Rak y otros funcionarios y por la mongola, la comitiva del ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y Comercio y el embajador mongol en Corea Sodovjamts Khurelbaatar.
					
					  En las conversaciones ambas partes informaron de las situaciones de sus respectivos paises e intercambiaron sus opiniones sobre el problema de desarrollar las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Ri Yong Ho se reune con delegacion militar de Cuba
articles.content:
Ri Yong Ho se reune con delegacion militar de Cuba
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ATCC) -- El jefe del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Ri Yong Ho, departio el dia 20 en un ambiente amistoso con la delegacion militar de las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cuba encabezada por Alvaro Lopez Miera, viceministro y jefe del Estado Mayor General de las FAR. 
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Pak Jae Gyong, y otros generales y oficiales del EPC, el embajador Jose Manuel Galego Montano y el agregado militar Leonardo Perez Mesa de la embajada cubana en Corea.

articles.title: EMG del EPC ofrece banquete en honor de delegacion cubana
articles.content:
EMG del EPC ofrece banquete en honor de delegacion cubana
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ATCC) -- El Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Corea ofrecio este martes un banquete en honor de la delegacion militar de las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cuba, de visita en Corea. 
					Fueron invitados los integrantes de la delegacion encabezada por el viceministro y jefe del Estado Mayor General de las FAR, Alvaro Lopez Miera, el embajador Jose Manuel Galego Montano y el agregado militar Leonardo Perez Mesa de la embajada cubana en Corea. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes el jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, Ri Yong Ho, el viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Pak Jae Gyong, los generales y oficiales del EPC.
					
					Al intervenir en la ocasion, Ri Yong Ho senalo que la visita a Corea de la delegacion militar cubana marca un importante hito para desarrollar en la etapa mas alta las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los ejercitos de los dos paises y otros vinculos bilaterales en general.
					
					Se refirio a que bajo la guia de los estimados companeros Fidel Castro Ruz y Raul Castro Ruz, el ejercito y el pueblo de Cuba defienden con firmeza las conquistas de la revolucion.
					
					Tras expresar el irrestricto apoyo y solidaridad con la lucha del pueblo cubano por defender la independencia antiimperialista y el principio socialista, fortalecer el poderio de defensa nacional y elevar el prestigio exterior del pais, ratifico que el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea se esforzaran tambien en el futuro por el mayor desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con el ejercito y el pueblo de Cuba. 
					
					Le siguio en usar la palabra Alvaro Lopez Miera.
					
					El dijo que la visita de su delegacion a Corea tiene una gran significacion porque coincide con el 50o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre la Republica de Cuba y la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Prosiguio que datan de mucho tiempo las relaciones de hermandad y combativas establecidas entre el companero Fidel Castro Ruz y el querido Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					Las historicas relaciones entre nuestros dos pueblos las continuan hoy el Comandante Supremo
						 Kim Jong Il y nuestro Presidente, General de Ejercito Raul Castro Ruz, destaco.
					
					Por eso, es un deber impostergable para nosotros continuar y fortalecer cada dia mas las relaciones de hermandad y fraternidad combativas entre las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cuba y las Fuerzas Armadas Populares de Corea, concluyo.

articles.content:
En Pyongyang delegacion militar de Cuba
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ATCC) -- Arribo este martes a esta capital la delegacion militar de las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cuba encabezada por Alvaro Lopez Miera, viceministro y jefe del Estado Mayor General de las FAR. 
					Este dia, tuvo lugar la ceremonia de bienvenida en la explanada frente al Monumento a la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					
					Al acto asistieron Alvaro Lopez Miera y otros integrantes de la delegacion cubana, el embajador y el agregado militar de la embajada cubana en Corea. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes tambien el jefe del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Ri Yong Ho, el viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Pak Jae Gyong, los generales y oficiales del EPC. 
					
					Ri Yong Ho y Alvaro Lopez Miera pasaron revista a la Guardia de Honor del EPC.

articles.title: Tiene lugar acto por 50o aniversario de levantamiento de 19 de abril
articles.content:
Tiene lugar acto por 50o aniversario de levantamiento de 19 de abril
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 19 en la Casa Central de Obreros el acto de la ciudad de Pyongyang por el 50o aniversario del Levantamiento Popular del 19 de Abril de los habitantes surcoreanos.
					Ese levantamiento desatado en 1960 con motivo de las fraudulentas "elecciones del 15 de marzo" de la camarilla traidora de Syngman Rhee hizo temblar de miedo al imperialismo yanqui y a esta banda extendiendose rapidamente a todo el suelo surcoreano y derribo finalmente el poder dictatorial fascista.
					
					En la ocasion participaron el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema Yang Hyong Sop, el presidente del CC del Partido Social-Democrata de Corea Kim Yong Dae, la presidenta del CC del Partido Chondoista Chong-u Ryu Mi Yong, el miembro de la presidencia del CC del Frente Democratico para la Reunificacion de la Patria Jo Chung Han, los funcionarios directivos de las organizaciones sociales, los rectores de las universidades, los funcionarios de los organos del poder, trabajadores, jovenes y estudiantes en la capital.
					
					El director del Secretariado del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria, An Kyong Ho, en su informe senalo que a traves del levantamiento del 19 de abril, los jovenes, estudiantes y habitantes surcoreanos demostraron claramente que no se puede doblegar por nada el impetu heroico y la indoblegable voluntad de los habitantes levantados para traer un nuevo mundo independiente y democratico y que las masas populares pueden aniquilar a los agresores y represores si luchan unidas. 
					
					Subrayo que el levantamiento popular estimulo mucho la lucha de los pueblos de varios paises contra la dominacion y subyugacion coloniales de los imperialistas.
					
					Recordo que en acato a la linea del Presidente  Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il sobre la independencia nacional y la reunificacion, los habitantes surcoreanos desplegaron luego el levantamiento popular de Kwangju de 1980 y otras resistencias y rebeliones masivas dando el golpe duro a la dominacion colonial fascista del imperialismo yanqui y la banda de titeres y registraron gran avance en la lucha por la independencia antiyanqui, la democracia antifascista y la reunificacion de la patria.
					
					Finalizo llamando a todos los coreanos del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar a librar energicamente la lucha por poner fin a la ocupacion militar y la dominacion de EE.UU. sobre el Sur de Corea, defender la dignidad y la soberania de la nacion y realizar cuanto antes la reunificacion de la patria.

Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano en China
Pyongyang, 20 de abril (ATCC) -- Segun un decreto del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Pyong Gwan fue designado como nuevo embajador coreano en China.
